page.title: 01North Bourne and Dyke
page.content: The Southern area includes recent housing estate developments in bourne, however aprat from this concentration the block is sparely populated. the small villages of dyke, cawthorpe and the south part of Morton are the only populated areas agriculture and forestry are the two main industrial activites. Bourne Wood extends along the west side of the block; this is owned by the forestry commission and is the eastward limit of the wooded and hilly land of south west Lincolnshire. Dyke itself sits on the edge of dyke fen which is about 6 feet above sea level. The land is rich and provides high grade farming. dyke has not een subject to development and remains a single street village with little new housing.
